title: Trump Hides Obama And Bush Portraits In White House Stairwell
summary: Trump Hides Obama And Bush Portraits In White House Stairwell Authored by Steve Watson via Modernity.news, President Trump has directed White House staff to relocate the official portraits of former Presidents Barack Obama and George W.
fullContent: Trump Hides Obama And Bush Portraits In White House Stairwell Authored by Steve Watson via Modernity.news, President Trump has directed White House staff to relocate the official portraits of former Presidents Barack Obama and George W. Bush out of view to all but those with the highest security clearances. CNN notes that the portraits are to be moved to the top of the Grand Staircase, a decision that ensures the former Presidents are now ‚Äúout of view from thousands of visitors who tour the White House each day.‚Äù The area is restricted to members of the first family only, along with Secret Service officials, and a limited number of White House and executive residence staff. Did you vote for President Trump to move Barack Obama and Bush's portraits to "a hidden stairwell?" pic.twitter.com/DK5kBZyrdA ‚Äî Cash Loren (@CashLorenShow) August 11, 2025 The relocation of the portraits, which were previously displayed prominently in the Grand Foyer near the entrance of the executive mansion, marks a stark departure from White House tradition. Typically, the two most recent presidential portraits are showcased in this high-traffic area to honor former leaders for state guests and visitors. However, with Trump‚Äôs and Joe Biden‚Äôs official portraits still in progress, Obama‚Äôs and Bush‚Äôs portraits had been holding those prominent spots. ‚ÄúOne of the sources added that the portraits of both Bushes are also now in the staircase area,‚Äù CNN further noted, indicating that not only Obama‚Äôs portrait but also those of former President George W. Bush and his father, former President George H.W. Bush, have been moved to less conspicuous locations. It‚Äôs hardly surprising given the revelations concerning Obama‚Äôs effort to frame Trump with fake Russia collusion charges. Obama‚Äôs portrait has been replaced in the Grand Foyer with a painting depicting Trump raising his fist after surviving an assassination attempt in July 2024 in Butler, Pennsylvania. Obama's WH portrait just got replaced pic.twitter.com/LN3czTqYo3 ‚Äî End Wokeness (@EndWokeness) April 11, 2025 The White House‚Äôs official X account shared a video of the new artwork, captioning it, ‚ÄúSome new artwork at the White House üëÄ.‚Äù Some new artwork at the White House üëÄ pic.twitter.com/l6u5u7k82T ‚Äî The White House (@WhiteHouse) April 11, 2025 The new painting of Trump, based on photographs by Associated Press photographer Evan Vucci and New York Times photographer Doug Mills, captures a defining moment from his 2024 campaign. While the artist behind the painting remains unconfirmed, it is distinct from Trump‚Äôs official White House portrait, which is traditionally unveiled after a president leaves office. This move is not the first time Trump has altered White House portrait placements. During his previous term, he replaced portraits of former Presidents Bill Clinton and George W. Bush in the Grand Foyer with those of William McKinley and Theodore Roosevelt. The White House, the White House Historical Association, and a representative for Obama were contacted for comment, but only the White House Historical Association responded, directing inquiries back to the White House. An Obama spokesperson declined to comment. The tradition of presidential portraits, privately funded by the nonprofit White House Historical Association, became formalized in the 1960s under former First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy. Obama himself reflected on the significance of these portraits during his 2022 unveiling, stating, ‚ÄúWhen future generations walk these halls and look up at these portraits, I hope they get a better honest sense of who Michelle and I were. And I hope they leave with a deeper understanding that if we could make it here, maybe they can, too. They can do remarkable things, too.‚Äù Yeah, nope. Not any more Barry. While leftists on social media are seething about Trump‚Äôs move, others suggested the Obama and Bush portraits were not moved far enough away from view. Overwhelming majority of voting Americans. ‚Äî Carissa (@njoyzgrl81) August 11, 2025 pic.twitter.com/mTQKEEljKh ‚Äî Jonas Cord üá∫üá∏ (@JonasCord1961) August 10, 2025 pic.twitter.com/FOk7Do7pdE ‚Äî Donna Marie (@sabback) August 10, 2025 Looks like they found a much better location for Obama's portrait üòè pic.twitter.com/jNoaChxvSJ ‚Äî Based Electrician‚ö°Ô∏èüá∫üá≤ (@RyanHugeBrain) April 11, 2025 BREAKING:Pres Trump has relocated the official portrait of former Pres Obama to a bathroom w/in the #WhiteHouse This shift places official portrait of Barack Obama in a significantly less visible location,stressing the continuous tensions that have remained between #44th & #47th pic.twitter.com/042HnbZwwC ‚Äî Sandy (@SD73660) August 10, 2025 You‚Äôre crying about Trump yanking the portraits of Obama, George W. Bush, and George H.W. Bush from their so-called "place of honor" and shoving them into a hidden stairwell, acting like he‚Äôs desecrated some sacred fucking tradition. First off, let‚Äôs torch your precious‚Ä¶ ‚Äî LHGrey‚Ñ¢Ô∏è (@grey4626) August 10, 2025 Looks like President Trump figured out what to do with the Obama portrait üéØüòÇ pic.twitter.com/PCqGsx2JUm ‚Äî Politi_Rican üáµüá∑ ùïè üá∫üá∏ (@TheRicanMemes) August 11, 2025 Found where Trump moved Obama and Bush's portraits in the White House üöΩ pic.twitter.com/rSnQCzVwGW ‚Äî ùïèerias (@xerias_x) August 11, 2025 I found a place for Obama's portrait. It got me sick as hell though looking at him. Would u use this toilet ü™† pic.twitter.com/RIAlyaVZVG ‚Äî MAGA LION (@nightster2024) August 11, 2025 * * * Your support is crucial in helping us defeat mass censorship. Please consider donating via Locals or check out our unique merch. Follow us on X @ModernityNews. Tyler Durden Tue, 08/12/2025 - 13:40

title: Crypto Entrepreneur Do Kwon Pleads Guilty to Fraud Charges Stemming From Crypto Crash

fullContent: A consortium led by TPG Inc. and the Qatar Investment Authority has offered to buy out Hong Kong-listed Kangji Medical Holdings Ltd. in a deal that values the Chinese medical device maker at about HK$11.2 billion ($1.4 billion).

EIA: Oil Prices Headed for Steep Slide as U.S. Output Peaks
summary: Brent crude prices are on track for a sharp decline in the coming months, with the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) now forecasting prices to fall from $71 per barrel in July to an average of $58 in the fourth quarter of 2025‚Äîand to slip toward $50 in early 2026.
fullContent: Brent crude prices are on track for a sharp decline in the coming months, with the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) now forecasting prices to fall from $71 per barrel in July to an average of $58 in the fourth quarter of 2025‚Äîand to slip toward $50 in early 2026. The August Short-Term Energy Outlook pins the drop on aggressive OPEC+ supply growth, which is expected to drive global inventory builds above 2 million barrels per day in late 2025 and early 2026‚Äînearly 800,000 bpd more than last month‚Äôs forecast.
